required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Fertility Treatments and Fertility Preservation
clinical_study.official_title: Studies Aiming at Identifying Predictors for Fertility Treatments' Outcomes and to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Fertility Preservation

brief_summary.textblock:
This study analyses clinical data prospectively collected for over a decade in several clinical databases. Electronic medical records are available since 1998.
Since 2011 the subgroup of patients that undergo fertility preservation are invited to participate in a prospective study aiming at long-term follow-up after fertility preservation for oncologic and non-oncologic conditions.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study, the investigators aim at analyze the treatment outcomes of patients with infertility, their clinical characteristics and biochemical parameters aiming at identifying predictors for the treatment outcomes.
For the cohort of patients that have undergone fertility preservation at Karolinska University Hospital, the investigators aim at investigating efficacy and safety of the procedures.
The data can be expanded by using additional databases such as the Regional Cancer Registry and other registries.
Analysis of data collected will allow the investigation of efficacy and safety of fertility preservation, identification of predictors for fertility outcomes,prediction of future activities and costs of the procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy and safety of fertility preservation - Long-term follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Correlation between method of fertility preservation and pregnacy rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical outcome of fertility treatments i breast cancer patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fertility treatment vs no fertility treatment i breastcancer patients: effect on survival

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical outcome of fertility treatments i breast cancer patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fertility treatment vs no fertility treatment i breastcancer patients: effect on disease free survival

secondary_outcome.time_frame: patient data collected from time of treatment, pregnancy rate until end of study
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between clinical variables (age, BMI, oocyte level, administered gonadotropins, infertility) method of fertility preservation and Pregnancy rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy and safety of COS using GnRHa for fertility preservation in BC patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Observed outcomes in patients registered between 1995 and 2017. Follow up until end of 2018.
secondary_outcome.description: hCG vs GnRH trigger on effect on number of cryopreserved embryos and oocytes

arm_group.description: subgroup analysis by cause of infertility, clinical characteristics, biochemical markers
subgroup analysis by cause of infertility, clinical characteristics, biochemical markers

intervention.description: fertility preservation using assisted reproductive techniques or not

study_pop.textblock: Cohort collected from the registers of the university hospitals of Sweden, each representing a health care region, from 1995 and ongoing. FP is included in the tax funded healthcare system and data is registered all over the country. Date is also compared with the Swedish tax registry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- infertile patients and patients who undergo fertility preservation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Healthy individuals, fertile population
